children.value: In 2016 the scientific publisher Springer Nature retracted 58 papers from seven journals, authored mostly by Iran-based researchers, because the papers showed evidence of authorship manipulation, peer-review manipulation, and/or plagiarism.

children.label: In 2016 the scientific publisher Springer Nature retracted 58 papers from seven journals, authored mostly by Iran-based researchers, because the papers showed evidence of authorship manipulation, peer-review manipulation, and/or plagiarism.

children.value: Ohio University in 2006 alleged more than three dozen cases of plagiarism in master’s degree theses dating back 20 years in its mechanical engineering department.

children.label: Ohio University in 2006 alleged more than three dozen cases of plagiarism in master’s degree theses dating back 20 years in its mechanical engineering department.

children.value: A former faculty member involved in the plagiarism cases,
, was removed from his position as department chair, had his title of “distinguished professor” rescinded.

children.label: A former faculty member involved in the plagiarism cases, Jay S. Gunasekera, was removed from his position as department chair, had his title of “distinguished professor” rescinded.

children.value: 486 Chinese cancer researchers were found guilty of engaging in a fraudulent peer-review scheme by China’s Ministry of Science and Technology. The investigation was initiated after the retraction of 107 papers published in Tumor Biology between 2012 and 2016. This is reported to be the most papers retracted from one journal.

children.label: 486 Chinese cancer researchers were found guilty of engaging in a fraudulent peer-review scheme by China’s Ministry of Science and Technology. The investigation was initiated after the retraction of 107 papers published in Tumor Biology between 2012 and 2016. This is reported to be the most papers retracted from one journal.

children.value: The number of retractions in scientific publications has been increasing over time:

children.label: The number of retractions in scientific publications has been increasing over time:

children.value: - Before 2000, there were fewer than 100 annual retractions

children.label: - Before 2000, there were fewer than 100 annual retractions

children.value: - By 2014, this number had grown to nearly 1000 retractions per year

children.label: - By 2014, this number had grown to nearly 1000 retractions per year

children.value: - In 2023, over 10,000 research papers were retracted globally, marking a new record

children.label: - In 2023, over 10,000 research papers were retracted globally, marking a new record

children.value: However, the rate of increase in retractions has slowed in recent years:

children.label: However, the rate of increase in retractions has slowed in recent years:

children.value: - The retraction rate roughly doubled from 2003 to 2009

children.label: - The retraction rate roughly doubled from 2003 to 2009

children.value: - Since 2012, the rate has remained relatively level

children.label: - Since 2012, the rate has remained relatively level

children.value: - Retractions still remain rare, with only about 4 out of every 10,000 papers being retracted

children.label: - Retractions still remain rare, with only about 4 out of every 10,000 papers being retracted

children.value: database provides insights into reasons for retraction:

children.label: The Retraction Watch database provides insights into reasons for retraction:

children.value: - Nearly 40% of retraction notices did not mention fraud or misconduct

children.label: - Nearly 40% of retraction notices did not mention fraud or misconduct

children.value: - About 50% of retractions involved fabrication, falsification, or plagiarism

children.label: - About 50% of retractions involved fabrication, falsification, or plagiarism

children.value: - 10% were due to behaviors like forged authorship or fake peer reviews

children.label: - 10% were due to behaviors like forged authorship or fake peer reviews

Theranos foi uma empresa americana de serviços de saúde-tecnologia e médico-laboratorial privada sediada em Palo Alto, Califórnia. A empresa esteve sob investigação criminal pelo Departamento de Justiça dos Estados Unidos e a Comissão de valores Mobiliários dos Estados Unidos.

children.label: Theranos foi uma empresa americana de serviços de saúde-tecnologia e médico-laboratorial privada sediada em Palo Alto, Califórnia. A empresa esteve sob investigação criminal pelo Departamento de Justiça dos Estados Unidos e a Comissão de valores Mobiliários dos Estados Unidos.

children.value: Theranos desenvolveu um dispositivo denominado Edison, que supostamente precisaria apenas de algumas gotas de sangue - obtidas mediante uma simples picada no dedo, em vez de vários frascos de sangue coletado por meio de punção venosa - para realizar centenas de testes, utilizando tecnologia de micro fluidos.
A Theranos sempre manteve sua tecnologia em segredo, mesmo após apresentar problemas de confiabilidade tão sérios que levaram o
a cancelarem as parcerias com a empresa.
por revelar segredos da empresa, e por levantar suspeições de fraude, e em 2013
, um dos principais cientistas, acabou por se suicidar após sofrer pressões para não testemunhar a favor de
, neto de um dos diretores da empresa, colaborou com o jornalista
do Wall Street Journal, e denunciou toda a fraude.
No verão de 2014, seus fundadores levantaram mais de US$ 400 milhões com investidores, avaliando a empresa em
Em junho de 2016, Forbes revisou sua estimativa do patrimônio líquido da empresa em US$ 800 milhões.
Em 2023, Elizabeth Holmes começou a cumprir uma pena de mais de 11 anos
Amanda Seyfried won an Emmy for portraying the disgraced Theranos CEO in Hulu series ‘The Dropout.’
é a área da filosofia dedicada às ações e ao comportamento humano, filosofia moral. O objeto de estudo da ética são os princípios que orientam as ações humanas e a capacidade de avaliar essas ações.
se diferenciam por a ética ser compreendida de maneira universal, enquanto a moral está sempre ligada aos fatores sociais e culturais que influenciam os comportamentos.
De uma forma sucinta, a ética é uma teoria que se ocupa dos princípios que orientam as ações, já a moral é prática e está relacionada às regras de conduta.
